an5.68:4.1: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still not awake but intent on awakening—I developed and cultivated five things.
an5.68:4.3: The basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to energy, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to higher mind, and active endeavor … the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to inquiry, and active endeavor. And the fifth is just vigour.
an5.68:4.4: When I had developed and cultivated these five things, with vigour as fifth, I became capable of realizing anything that can be realized by turning my mind toward insight, in each and every case.
an5.68:5.2: ‘May I multiply myself and becoming one again … control the body as far as the Brahmā realm.’ I was capable of realizing it, in each and every case.
an5.68:6.1: If I wished: ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having achieved it with my own insight due to the end of defilements.’ I was capable of realizing it, in each and every case.”
